channel.title: Boards shipping
channel.description:
Hey guys any small update on how far u guys are in shipping can see lot of people have gotten there boards.... but i still wait on email regarding shipping... is this becouse i ordered a larger amount (5 in all)
Hope to hear something soon... i really wanna patch and have the possibilty to actually listen what i make..
Regards
Kalle

item.description:
@chriss wrote:

Hi, I've just ordered my first Axoloti Core and am very much looking forward to getting my hands on it. Presumably, Johannes you will just work through the backlog of orders and ship according to the delivery address on the web order or do you still send out an email when you are ready to ship and await for confirmation.

It looks like the latest batch due on 20th April is already almost sold out! I'm not surprised as this is a fantastic project.

Read full topic

item.title: Boards shipping
item.dc:creator: @Alancarl Alan Ayoub
item.description:
@Alancarl wrote:

Thanks Johannes,
I'm going to go for it!
I am a career professional guitarist and I have been working with guitar synth rigs for >35 years. The Fisman Triple Play is very fast when hosted by a dedicated hardware device like their FC-1 foot controller/host.
It provides me with a stable midi guitar controller so I can really tell the difference in latencies encounter with different types of synth sound generation.
Not all digital processes are equally as fast.
Your offering sould perfect for what I have been trying to do for so many years!
Thanks Johannes,
Al

Read full topic

item.title: Boards shipping
item.dc:creator: @johannes johannes
item.description:
@johannes wrote:

Unfortunately the Belgian Post insists on 

Company Name
Surname Lastname
Streetname Housenumber Box
Postcode City
Country

while many countries put streetname before housenumber. To make things worse every field has a limited length.
For the USA I routinely move the housenumber into the streetname field, and put a dot in housenumber (it requires minimum one character...). Often I have to move parts of the streetname into the housenumber or box field because it goes over the length limit of the streetname. The structure does not seem to matter, as long as it prints right on the shipping label (which I check), except for the zipcode.
State is not needed, it's redundant with the zipcode. Parcels appear to be pre-sorted in Belgium and land in the right side of the USA for further processing.

I raised this issue with BPost a couple of times, but haven't seen any change so far.

But the good news: I can recall only a single parcel that bounced back shipping to the USA (and I don't remember why it bounced) - out of many many shipped to the USA.

Read full topic

item.title: Boards shipping
item.dc:creator: @Alancarl Alan Ayoub
item.description:
@Alancarl wrote:

Hi everybody and particularly Johannes,
I am in the U.S. And I wanting to order a Axoloti core but I'm hesitant as the web store does not seem to be formatting the City State address correctly.
I think the automated postal machines might balk at this.
Here is a link to the U.S. postal service that describes the correct US address formatting.
http://pe.usps.com/businessmail101/addressing/deliveryAddress.htm

Now if the web store uses the PayPal shipping address formatting that of course is correct.

I will wait to see if this can be sorted out even though I really want to buy into this terrific platformright away!,
Thanks,
Al

Read full topic

item.title: Boards shipping
item.dc:creator: @RSP
item.description:
@RSP wrote:

I'm also on the east coast. I filled out the address confirmation two days ago, I'll let you know when mine arrives for comparison.

Incidentally, the form doesn't follow the typical US postal address format so I put "[town], [state]" in the "municipality" field since there weren't separate fields for each. I don't expect that will be an issue but I can imagine how it might cause a small delay. I've shipped enough stuff back when I used to sell records to know from hard experience that when different postal systems have to cooperate things can sometimes get weird.

Read full topic

item.title: Boards shipping
item.dc:creator: @ricard Ricard Wanderlof
item.description:
@ricard wrote:

Naturally all backers should have top priority having backed the project. It's hard to know how big any additional demand might be, but I think there are probably several people who are either late to the table (like me) or just have adopted a wait-and-see mentality, who would be potential buyers if there were boards available. Johannes probably already has some idea of the interest.

Read full topic

item.title: Boards shipping
item.dc:creator: @thetechnobear Mark Harris
item.description:
@thetechnobear wrote:

The boards were 'built to order', I think claimed really is more an indication of the total amount that 'could be made'.

I think its highly likely [1] there will be more boards made available after all backers have received their boards, but given how busy Johannes is doing the fulfilment (and of course its his #1 priority) , we probably should give him a 'bit of space', then he will get on to this, and a few other things people are requesting.

btw, it probably wouldn't be a bad idea, starting a thread, so that Johannes has an idea of the demand for additional boards.

[1] I think Johannes said something along the lines of, its possible assuming there is demand etc.

Read full topic
